tasks.subject: [og-seo-ai-readability-overhaul] [P1] Rewrite opengraph-image.tsx with unified share card design
tasks.description:
Completely rewrite `apps/web/src/app/opengraph-image.tsx` with the new unified share card design. ## Design Specification - **Background:** Solid gradient from `#1A1A1A` to `#2A2A2A`, angled 135 degrees - **Logo:** Dorkian logo SVG (geometric DORK lettering), white `#FFFFFF`, centered horizontally, upper third - **Headline line 1:** "Your agents are brilliant." — white `#FFFFFF`, 48px, weight 700, centered - **Headline line 2:** "They just can't do anything when you leave." — warm orange `#E86C3A`, 48px, weight 700, centered (split across two `` elements) - **Tagline:** "You slept. They shipped." — muted gray `#9A9A9A`, 24px, weight 300, centered - **Bottom bar:** 4px `#E86C3A` stripe + 4px `#5B8C5A` stripe at absolute bottom - **Dimensions:** 1200x630, PNG format - **No custom fonts** — edge runtime only supports system fonts ## Complete File Content Replace the entire file with: ```tsx import { ImageResponse } from 'next/og' export const runtime = 'edge' export const alt = 'DorkOS - The operating system for autonomous AI agents' export const size = { width: 1200, height: 630, } export const contentType = 'image/png' export default async function Image() { return new ImageResponse( (
{/* Dorkian logo SVG -- geometric DORK lettering in white */} {/* Headline */}
Your agents are brilliant. They just can't do anything when you leave.
{/* Tagline */} You slept. They shipped. {/* Bottom accent stripes */}
), { ...size } ) } ``` ## Acceptance Criteria 1. Visiting `/opengraph-image` in a browser renders the new design with gradient background, Dorkian logo, two-line headline, tagline, and bottom accent stripes 2. Image dimensions are 1200x630 pixels, PNG format 3. The `alt` export reads "DorkOS - The operating system for autonomous AI agents" 4. Edge runtime is used (no Node.js APIs) 5. No custom font imports (system sans-serif only) 6. The old graph-paper pattern design is fully replaced
tasks.activeForm: Rewriting opengraph-image.tsx with unified share card design

tasks.subject: [og-seo-ai-readability-overhaul] [P1] Replace twitter-image.tsx with re-export from opengraph-image
tasks.description:
Replace the entire contents of `apps/web/src/app/twitter-image.tsx` with a re-export from `opengraph-image.tsx`. This guarantees OG and Twitter share cards are always identical.

## Complete File Content

Replace the entire file with:

```tsx
// Twitter uses the exact same image as OpenGraph for consistency.
// Re-exporting ensures both routes always render identically.
export { default, alt, size, contentType, runtime } from './opengraph-image'
```

## Why Re-export Instead of Duplicate

The current `twitter-image.tsx` has different copy ("Build fast. Learn faster.") from `opengraph-image.tsx` ("Claude Code in your browser."). By re-exporting, both routes are guaranteed to render the exact same image. Any future change to the OG image automatically propagates to the Twitter card.

## Acceptance Criteria

1. `twitter-image.tsx` contains only the re-export line (plus comment)
2. Visiting `/twitter-image` in a browser renders the exact same image as `/opengraph-image`
3. All five named exports (`default`, `alt`, `size`, `contentType`, `runtime`) are re-exported
4. No duplicate rendering logic remains
tasks.activeForm: Replacing twitter-image.tsx with re-export from opengraph-image

tasks.subject: [og-seo-ai-readability-overhaul] [P1] Fix marketing layout metadata to resolve iMessage share card bug
tasks.description:
Fix the iMessage share card bug in `apps/web/src/app/(marketing)/layout.tsx`.

## Problem

The current `(marketing)/layout.tsx` exports an `openGraph` metadata object without an `images` field. Next.js metadata merging treats this as a full override (not a deep merge), which strips the dynamically generated OG image from the merged output. iMessage (which relies on `og:image`) shows no preview image.

## Fix

Add an explicit `images` array to the `openGraph` metadata object referencing the dynamic OG image route.

Update the `metadata` export to include:

```typescript
export const metadata: Metadata = {
  title: `${siteConfig.name} - ${siteConfig.description}`,
  description: metaDescription,
  openGraph: {
    title: `${siteConfig.name} - ${siteConfig.description}`,
    description: metaDescription,
    url: '/',
    type: 'website',
    images: [
      {
        url: '/opengraph-image',
        width: 1200,
        height: 630,
        alt: 'DorkOS - The operating system for autonomous AI agents',
      },
    ],
  },
  alternates: {
    canonical: '/',
  },
}
```

## Implementation Steps

1. Open `apps/web/src/app/(marketing)/layout.tsx`
2. Locate the existing `metadata` export (around lines 11-16)
3. Add the `images` array to the `openGraph` object
4. Ensure the `url`, `width`, `height`, and `alt` values match exactly as shown above
5. The `/opengraph-image` path is the convention Next.js uses for file-based OG image route handlers

## Technical Context

- Next.js metadata merging replaces (not deep-merges) the `openGraph` object when a child layout defines it
- By explicitly including the `images` field, the metadata merge chain preserves the image reference through the marketing layout
- The `alt` text matches the `alt` export in `opengraph-image.tsx`

## Acceptance Criteria

1. The `openGraph` metadata in `(marketing)/layout.tsx` includes an `images` array with one entry
2. The image entry points to `/opengraph-image` with dimensions 1200x630
3. Sharing the homepage URL on iMessage shows the preview card with the OG image
4. Facebook Sharing Debugger confirms `og:image` is present
5. Docs pages still have correct metadata (no regressions from the layout change)
6. The `alternates.canonical` field is set to `'/'`
tasks.activeForm: Fixing marketing layout metadata for iMessage share card bug

tasks.subject: [og-seo-ai-readability-overhaul] [P2] Add blog posts to sitemap.ts
tasks.description:
Update `apps/web/src/app/sitemap.ts` to include all blog posts in the XML sitemap.

## Complete File Content

Replace the entire file with:

```typescript
import type { MetadataRoute } from 'next'
import { siteConfig } from '@/config/site'
import { source, blog } from '@/lib/source'

const BASE_URL = siteConfig.url

/**
 * Generate the sitemap for the DorkOS marketing site.
 *
 * Includes static marketing/legal pages, all Fumadocs documentation pages,
 * and all blog posts.
 */
export default function sitemap(): MetadataRoute.Sitemap {
  const staticPages: MetadataRoute.Sitemap = [
    {
      url: BASE_URL,
      lastModified: new Date(),
      changeFrequency: 'monthly',
      priority: 1.0,
    },
    {
      url: `${BASE_URL}/privacy`,
      lastModified: new Date(),
      changeFrequency: 'yearly',
      priority: 0.3,
    },
    {
      url: `${BASE_URL}/terms`,
      lastModified: new Date(),
      changeFrequency: 'yearly',
      priority: 0.3,
    },
    {
      url: `${BASE_URL}/cookies`,
      lastModified: new Date(),
      changeFrequency: 'yearly',
      priority: 0.3,
    },
    {
      url: `${BASE_URL}/blog`,
      lastModified: new Date(),
      changeFrequency: 'weekly',
      priority: 0.6,
    },
  ]

  const docPages: MetadataRoute.Sitemap = source.getPages().map((page) => ({
    url: `${BASE_URL}${page.url}`,
    lastModified: new Date(),
    changeFrequency: 'weekly' as const,
    priority: 0.7,
  }))

  const blogPages: MetadataRoute.Sitemap = blog.getPages().map((page) => ({
    url: `${BASE_URL}${page.url}`,
    lastModified: new Date(),
    changeFrequency: 'monthly' as const,
    priority: 0.6,
  }))

  return [...staticPages, ...docPages, ...blogPages]
}
```

## Changes from Current File

1. Import `blog` alongside `source` from `@/lib/source`
2. Add `/blog` index page to the `staticPages` array with `changeFrequency: 'weekly'` and `priority: 0.6`
3. Add a new `blogPages` array built from `blog.getPages()` with `changeFrequency: 'monthly'` and `priority: 0.6`
4. Spread `blogPages` into the return array

## Acceptance Criteria

1. Visiting `/sitemap.xml` includes all blog post URLs
2. Blog post entries have `changeFrequency: 'monthly'` and `priority: 0.6`
3. The `/blog` index page appears in the static pages section
4. Existing doc pages and static pages are unchanged
5. The `blog` import resolves correctly from `@/lib/source`

tasks.subject: [og-seo-ai-readability-overhaul] [P2] Create llms.txt for AI agent discoverability
tasks.description:
Create a new static file at `apps/web/public/llms.txt` following the llms.txt standard proposed by Jeremy Howard. This provides a structured entry point for AI agents exploring the site.

## Complete File Content

Create `apps/web/public/llms.txt` with:

```
# DorkOS

> The operating system for autonomous AI agents. Scheduling, communication, memory, and a command center. Open source. Self-hosted.

DorkOS is an OS-layer for AI agents that provides the scheduling, memory, communication, and coordination infrastructure that agents themselves don't provide. It runs on your machine, wraps the Claude Agent SDK, and gives your agents a web-based command center.

## Core Capabilities

- **Pulse Scheduler**: Cron-based scheduling for autonomous agent runs with approval workflows
- **Relay Message Bus**: Inter-agent communication with adapter system (Telegram, Webhooks)
- **Mesh Discovery**: Agent registry, topology visualization, and health monitoring
- **Chat Interface**: Web UI for Claude Code with tool approval flows and slash command discovery
- **CLI**: Install via `npm install -g dorkos` and run `dorkos` to start

## Documentation

- [Getting Started](https://dorkos.ai/docs/getting-started): Installation and first run
- [Configuration](https://dorkos.ai/docs/configuration): Server and agent configuration
- [Pulse Scheduler](https://dorkos.ai/docs/pulse): Autonomous scheduling setup
- [Relay Messaging](https://dorkos.ai/docs/relay): Inter-agent communication
- [Mesh Discovery](https://dorkos.ai/docs/mesh): Agent registry and topology
- [API Reference](https://dorkos.ai/docs/api): REST API documentation

## Links

- Website: https://dorkos.ai
- GitHub: https://github.com/dork-labs/dorkos
- npm: https://www.npmjs.com/package/dorkos
- Contact: hey@dorkos.ai
```

## Implementation Notes

- This is a plain text file in the `public/` directory, served statically by Next.js at `/llms.txt`
- The doc links should be verified against the actual `docs/` directory structure before committing. If specific doc slugs differ, update the URLs accordingly.
- The format follows the llms.txt convention: heading, blockquote summary, descriptive paragraph, sections with markdown links

## Acceptance Criteria

1. Visiting `https://dorkos.ai/llms.txt` returns the plain text content
2. The file contains the DorkOS description, core capabilities, documentation links, and contact info
3. All documentation URLs are valid and point to existing pages
4. The content-type is `text/plain`
tasks.activeForm: Creating llms.txt for AI agent discoverability

tasks.subject: [og-seo-ai-readability-overhaul] [P3] Add BlogPosting JSON-LD to blog post pages
tasks.description:
Add `BlogPosting` JSON-LD structured data to individual blog post pages in `apps/web/src/app/(marketing)/blog/[slug]/page.tsx`. This complements the existing `SoftwareApplication` and `WebSite` JSON-LD in the marketing layout.

## Implementation Steps

1. Open `apps/web/src/app/(marketing)/blog/[slug]/page.tsx`
2. Ensure `siteConfig` is imported from `@/config/site` (may already be imported)
3. Inside the page component function, after the `page` variable is resolved, construct the JSON-LD object:

```typescript
// BlogPosting JSON-LD structured data
const blogPostingJsonLd = {
  '@context': 'https://schema.org',
  '@type': 'BlogPosting',
  headline: page.data.title,
  description: page.data.description,
  datePublished: new Date(page.data.date).toISOString(),
  dateModified: new Date(page.data.date).toISOString(),
  author: page.data.author
    ? { '@type': 'Person', name: page.data.author }
    : { '@type': 'Organization', name: siteConfig.name },
  publisher: {
    '@type': 'Organization',
    name: siteConfig.name,
    url: siteConfig.url,
  },
  url: `${siteConfig.url}/blog/${params.slug}`,
  mainEntityOfPage: {
    '@type': 'WebPage',
    '@id': `${siteConfig.url}/blog/${params.slug}`,
  },
}
```

4. Add the JSON-LD script tag at the top of the component's return JSX (before the article content). Use the same XSS-safe pattern (`replace(/</g, '\\u003c')`) as the existing JSON-LD in `(marketing)/layout.tsx`:

```tsx
<script
  type="application/ld+json"
  dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{
    __html: JSON.stringify(blogPostingJsonLd).replace(/</g, '\\u003c'),
  }}
/>
```

Note: The content passed to dangerouslySetInnerHTML is server-controlled frontmatter data, not user input. The `replace()` call escapes closing tags to prevent XSS in the JSON-LD context, following the existing convention in the marketing layout.

## Technical Notes

- `dateModified` defaults to `datePublished` because Fumadocs blog frontmatter has no separate modified date field. This can be enhanced later if the schema adds one.
- Author falls back to the organization name when no `author` is specified in frontmatter.
- The XSS escaping pattern matches the existing convention in `(marketing)/layout.tsx`.
- The `params.slug` variable should already be available in the page component's props.
- You may need to wrap the return in a React Fragment (`<>...</>`) if the component currently returns a single element.

## Acceptance Criteria

1. Each blog post page includes a `<script type="application/ld+json">` tag with BlogPosting schema
2. The JSON-LD includes `headline`, `description`, `datePublished`, `dateModified`, `author`, `publisher`, `url`, and `mainEntityOfPage`
3. Google Rich Results Test validates the BlogPosting structured data on a blog post URL
4. Author is a Person when `page.data.author` exists, Organization when it doesn't
5. The XSS escaping pattern matches the existing convention in the marketing layout
6. No regressions to existing blog post rendering or metadata
tasks.activeForm: Adding BlogPosting JSON-LD to blog post pages

tasks.subject: [og-seo-ai-readability-overhaul] [P4] Remove dead ogImage from siteConfig and verify description
tasks.description:
Clean up `apps/web/src/config/site.ts` by removing the unused `ogImage` field and verifying the `description` matches current marketing copy.

## Step 1: Search for ogImage References

Before removing, run a codebase search to verify no code references `siteConfig.ogImage`:

```bash
grep -r "ogImage" apps/web/
```

If any references exist beyond the definition in `site.ts`, update them to remove the dependency before proceeding.

## Step 2: Update site.ts

Replace the entire file with:

```typescript
/**
 * Site-wide configuration for the DorkOS marketing site.
 *
 * Centralizes branding, URLs, and metadata so changes propagate
 * to layout metadata, JSON-LD, sitemap, robots, and OG images.
 */
export const siteConfig = {
  name: 'DorkOS',
  description:
    'The operating system for autonomous AI agents. Scheduling, communication, memory, and a command center. Open source. Self-hosted.',
  url: 'https://dorkos.ai',
  contactEmail: 'hey@dorkos.ai',
  github: 'https://github.com/dork-labs/dorkos',
  npm: 'https://www.npmjs.com/package/dorkos',

  /**
   * Disable the cookie consent banner across the entire site.
   * Set to `true` to hide the banner completely.
   */
  disableCookieBanner: true,
} as const

export type SiteConfig = typeof siteConfig
```

## What Changed

1. Removed the `ogImage: '/og-image.png'` field. The dynamic route handlers (`opengraph-image.tsx`, `twitter-image.tsx`) are the sole source of OG images. The static `/og-image.png` file does not exist in `apps/web/public/`.
2. Added a TSDoc comment to the `siteConfig` object explaining its purpose and propagation.
3. The `description` field already matches the current marketing copy: "The operating system for autonomous AI agents. Scheduling, communication, memory, and a command center. Open source. Self-hosted." Verify this still aligns with the homepage hero and update if it has diverged.

## Description Propagation

The `siteConfig.description` propagates to:
- Root layout `<meta name="description">`
- Marketing layout `og:description`
- `SoftwareApplication` JSON-LD `description`
- Any future metadata consumers

## Acceptance Criteria

1. `grep -r "ogImage" apps/web/` returns zero results
2. The `siteConfig` object no longer has an `ogImage` field
3. The `SiteConfig` type no longer includes `ogImage`
4. All existing metadata on marketing pages renders correctly (no regressions)
5. The `description` field matches the current homepage marketing copy
6. The TSDoc comment is present on the `siteConfig` export
tasks.activeForm: Removing dead ogImage from siteConfig and verifying description
